answers.answer: Are you prone to high blood pressure? That could be a cause...Also, since your body is producing more blood, your heart will tend to pump faster, which may also be the cause.I would call your doctor and seek their advice...that's the best thing you can do. Especially if it's becoming a regular thing.
high or low blood pressure can cause this.  I get them from now and then but I think mine is froming moving too fast.
Okay, thanks!  Glad I'm not the only one.  My blood pressure tends to run low anyway, but I will check it tonight.  Thanks again!
Go and see an optometrist (eye Doctor) because light flashes or floaters could also mean a retinal detachment, tear or a vitreous problem. I know because my cousin had similar problems.Goodluck
I had it with my first pregnancy. My doctor told me it was because of low sugar and told me to take a juice box or something sugary with me when I went out to stop it from happening.

When I was pg with my second baby, I started having episods of what I called a "white out". Instead of everything turning black, it would all become brite white. I thought it was due to hormone headaches, but never really found out what caused it. I would also get very light headed and nauseous with them. My first one hit while coming out of the grocery store. I was just glad I was pushing the cart and used it to guide me to the car, which is white. I would mention it to your dr if it is really bothering you. Hope this helps. Brandy

I am a mom who had Hellp syndrom 4 times. Take no risks. Sometimes you may get them if you are under a lot of stress. Since you have a family history it is never too cautious to have a doctor double check. If they catch problems early enough they can use medications and bed rest to help you carry to term without problems.

question: Hi everyone,  I will be 8 weeks pregnant on Sunday.  For about 2 weeks I have occasionally seen little spots or flashes of light in my line of sight.  My mother said this happened to her in early pregnancy and she went on to have an emergency C-section from preeclampsia.  She has already resigned me to the same fate even though from what I have read preeclampsia happens later on.  My question is did any of you "see spots" and what happened?  I'm not going back to the doctor until after Christmas.  Thanks! You are all so wise.
title: Seeing spots/flashes of light in early pregnancy
